---


## Description
Automatically manage lurkers and allows your viewers to check and track their lurking time.

![Picture](assets/media/lurk_title_2.png)

---

## Import Code
```scss

```

---

## Installation

1. Copy the import code from above and import the content

    ![Import Actions](assets/media/import_actions.png)

2. Move to the `Commands` tab and enable the imported commands

    ![How To Enable Commands](assets/media/enable_commands.png)

3. Done! ðŸ¥³

---

## Settings

- In the `[Extended Lurks] Lurk End` action, you can set whether you want to break the lurk with the `!unlurk` command only or whether every chat message of that user breaks their lurk.

    ![Picture](assets/media/lurk_settings_1.png)

{: .note }
If you only want to break lurks with the command, you can also remove the `Chat Message` trigger entirely.

- In the `[Extended Lurk] Stats & Leaderboard` action, you can set how many ranks are being shown in the leaderboard message.

  ![Picture](assets/media/lurk_settings_2.png)



---

## Commands

- ## `!LURK`
  {: .no_toc }

  Starts the lurk.

---

- ## `!UNLURK`
  {: .no_toc }

  Ends the lurk.

---

- ## `!LURKERS`
  {: .no_toc }

  Shows the current lurkers in chat.

---

- ## `!LURKSTATS`
  {: .no_toc }

  Shows your own lurk stats in chat.

---

- ## `!LURKLEADERBOARD`
  {: .no_toc }

  Shows the lurk leaderboard in chat.

---

{: .note }
If someone's still lurking when the stream goes offline, it will automatically remove them as a lurker and add their time to their total time.

---

## Changelog

| Date        | Changes          | Version |
|:-------------|:------------------|:------------------|
| May 13, 2024           | Added a `Twitch Stream Offline` trigger to add lurker's time after the stream ends | 0.2.4 |
